Queries

contentValidation

Description

Validates content against accessibility standards and platform requirements. Performs comprehensive checks for compliance and quality assurance.

@param id - ID of the content to validate @returns Validation results including warnings and errors if any

Response

Returns a ContentValidationPayload!

Arguments
Name Description
id - ID!

Example

Query
query ContentValidation($id: ID!) {
  contentValidation(id: $id) {
    success
    validation {
      isValid
      errors {
        ...ContentValidationErrorFragment
      }
      warnings {
        ...ContentValidationWarningFragment
      }
      metadata
    }
    errors {
      code
      message
      field
      details
    }
  }
}
Variables
{"id": 4}
Response
{
  "data": {
    "contentValidation": {
      "success": true,
      "validation": ContentValidation,
      "errors": [ContentError]
    }
  }
}
Queries

course

Description

Retrieves detailed information about a specific course by its unique identifier. Returns comprehensive course data including modules, enrollments, and analytics.

@param id - Unique identifier of the course @throws NotFoundError if course doesn't exist @throws AuthorizationError if user lacks permission to view the course

Response

Returns a CoursePayload!

Arguments
Name Description
id - ID!

Example

Query
query Course($id: ID!) {
  course(id: $id) {
    success
    course {
      id
      title
      description
      modules {
        ...ModuleFragment
      }
      instructors {
        ...InstructorFragment
      }
      enrollments {
        ...EnrollmentFragment
      }
      status
      difficultyLevel
      duration
      prerequisites {
        ...CourseFragment
      }
      learningObjectives
      skills {
        ...SkillFragment
      }
      assessments {
        ...AssessmentFragment
      }
      certificate {
        ...CertificateFragment
      }
      metadata {
        ...CourseMetadataFragment
      }
      reviews {
        ...ReviewFragment
      }
      rating
      accessLevel
      accessGroups
      visibility
      tags
      searchMetadata
      createdBy
      updatedBy
      version
      createdAt
      updatedAt
      auditLog {
        ...AuditEntryFragment
      }
      analytics {
        ...CourseAnalyticsFragment
      }
    }
    errors {
      code
      message
      field
      details
    }
  }
}
Variables
{"id": "4"}
Response
{
  "data": {
    "course": {
      "success": true,
      "course": Course,
      "errors": [CourseError]
    }
  }
}
Queries

courseAnalytics

Description

Retrieves comprehensive analytics data for a specific course within a date range. Includes enrollment metrics, completion rates, assessment statistics, and revenue data.

@param courseId - ID of the course to analyze @param dateRange - Optional date range for filtering analytics data @throws NotFoundError if course doesn't exist @throws AuthorizationError if user lacks analytics access permission

Response

Returns a CourseAnalytics!

Arguments
Name Description
courseId - ID!
dateRange - DateRangeInput

Example

Query
query CourseAnalytics(
  $courseId: ID!,
  $dateRange: DateRangeInput
) {
  courseAnalytics(
    courseId: $courseId,
    dateRange: $dateRange
  ) {
    totalEnrollments
    activeEnrollments
    completionRate
    averageProgress
    averageTimeToComplete
    dropoutRate
    assessmentStats {
      averageScore
      passRate
      submissionRate
      averageAttempts
    }
    engagementMetrics {
      averageSessionDuration
      averageSessionsPerUser
      contentCompletionRates {
        ...CompletionRateFragment
      }
      discussionParticipationRate
    }
    revenueMetrics {
      totalRevenue
      averageRevenuePerStudent
      revenueByPeriod {
        ...RevenuePeriodFragment
      }
      refundRate
      lifetimeValue
    }
    trendsData {
      enrollmentTrend {
        ...TimeSeriesDataFragment
      }
      completionTrend {
        ...TimeSeriesDataFragment
      }
      engagementTrend {
        ...TimeSeriesDataFragment
      }
    }
  }
}
Variables
{"courseId": 4, "dateRange": DateRangeInput}
Response
{
  "data": {
    "courseAnalytics": {
      "totalEnrollments": 987,
      "activeEnrollments": 987,
      "completionRate": 987.65,
      "averageProgress": 987.65,
      "averageTimeToComplete": 987,
      "dropoutRate": 987.65,
      "assessmentStats": AssessmentStats,
      "engagementMetrics": EngagementMetrics,
      "revenueMetrics": RevenueMetrics,
      "trendsData": TrendsData
    }
  }
}

enrollmentProgress

Description

Retrieves detailed progress information for a specific enrollment. Includes completion status, time spent, and achievement data.

@param enrollmentId - ID of the enrollment to check progress @throws NotFoundError if enrollment doesn't exist @throws AuthorizationError if user lacks permission to view progress

Response

Returns a ProgressPayload!

Arguments
Name Description
enrollmentId - ID!

Example

Query
query EnrollmentProgress($enrollmentId: ID!) {
  enrollmentProgress(enrollmentId: $enrollmentId) {
    success
    progress {
      id
      enrollment {
        ...EnrollmentFragment
      }
      lesson {
        ...LessonFragment
      }
      module {
        ...ModuleFragment
      }
      status
      percentage
      lastActivity
      timeSpent
      completedItems
      totalItems
      metadata {
        ...ProgressMetadataFragment
      }
    }
    errors {
      code
      message
      field
      details
    }
  }
}
Variables
{"enrollmentId": "4"}
Response
{
  "data": {
    "enrollmentProgress": {
      "success": false,
      "progress": Progress,
      "errors": [ProgressError]
    }
  }
}
Queries

getSubscribers

Description

Retrieves a list of subscribers based on optional filtering criteria. If no filters are provided, returns all subscribers.

@param phoneNumber - Optional E.164 format phone number to filter subscribers @param name - Optional name to filter subscribers by first or last name

Response

Returns [Subscriber!]!

Arguments
Name Description
phoneNumber - String
name - String

Example

Query
query GetSubscribers(
  $phoneNumber: String,
  $name: String
) {
  getSubscribers(
    phoneNumber: $phoneNumber,
    name: $name
  ) {
    details {
      phoneNumber
      firstName
      lastName
      birthDay
    }
  }
}
Variables
{
  "phoneNumber": "xyz789",
  "name": "abc123"
}
Response
{
  "data": {
    "getSubscribers": [{"details": SubscriberDetails}]
  }
}

Queries

searchCourses

Description

Performs an advanced search across all courses based on multiple criteria. Supports pagination and returns aggregated statistics about the search results.

@param filter - Optional search criteria including text, difficulty level, ratings, etc. @param pagination - Optional pagination parameters for result set control @returns CourseConnection with edges, pagination info, and result aggregations

Response

Returns a CourseConnection!

Arguments
Name Description
filter - CourseSearchFilter
pagination - PaginationInput

Example

Query
query SearchCourses(
  $filter: CourseSearchFilter,
  $pagination: PaginationInput
) {
  searchCourses(
    filter: $filter,
    pagination: $pagination
  ) {
    edges {
      node {
        ...CourseFragment
      }
      cursor
    }
    pageInfo {
      hasNextPage
      hasPreviousPage
      startCursor
      endCursor
    }
    totalCount
    aggregations {
      byDifficulty {
        ...DifficultyCountFragment
      }
      byStatus {
        ...StatusCountFragment
      }
      byEnrollmentCount {
        ...EnrollmentRangeFragment
      }
      byCompletionRate {
        ...CompletionRateRangeFragment
      }
      byRating {
        ...RatingRangeFragment
      }
    }
  }
}
Variables
{
  "filter": CourseSearchFilter,
  "pagination": PaginationInput
}
Response
{
  "data": {
    "searchCourses": {
      "edges": [CourseEdge],
      "pageInfo": PageInfo,
      "totalCount": 987,
      "aggregations": CourseAggregations
    }
  }
}

Queries

userEnrollments

Description

Retrieves all enrollments for a specific user with optional status filtering. Results are paginated and include detailed progress information.

@param userId - ID of the user whose enrollments to retrieve @param status - Optional filter for enrollment status @param pagination - Optional pagination parameters @throws AuthorizationError if requester lacks permission to view user's enrollments

Response

Returns an EnrollmentConnection!

Arguments
Name Description
userId - ID!
status - ProgressStatus
pagination - PaginationInput

Example

Query
query UserEnrollments(
  $userId: ID!,
  $status: ProgressStatus,
  $pagination: PaginationInput
) {
  userEnrollments(
    userId: $userId,
    status: $status,
    pagination: $pagination
  ) {
    edges {
      node {
        ...EnrollmentFragment
      }
      cursor
    }
    pageInfo {
      hasNextPage
      hasPreviousPage
      startCursor
      endCursor
    }
    totalCount
  }
}
Variables
{
  "userId": "4",
  "status": "NOT_STARTED",
  "pagination": PaginationInput
}
Response
{
  "data": {
    "userEnrollments": {
      "edges": [EnrollmentEdge],
      "pageInfo": PageInfo,
      "totalCount": 123
    }
  }
}
Queries

validateCertificate

Description

Validates the authenticity and current status of a certificate. Verifies digital signatures and checks revocation status.

@param id - Unique identifier of the certificate to validate @returns Validation status and detailed certificate information if valid

Response

Returns a CertificateValidationPayload!

Arguments
Name Description
id - ID!

Example

Query
query ValidateCertificate($id: ID!) {
  validateCertificate(id: $id) {
    success
    isValid
    certificate {
      id
      type
      issuedTo {
        ...UserFragment
      }
      course {
        ...CourseFragment
      }
      issuedAt
      expiresAt
      validationHash
      metadata {
        ...CertificateMetadataFragment
      }
      status
      issuer {
        ...UserFragment
      }
    }
    validationDetails
    errors {
      code
      message
      field
      details
    }
  }
}
Variables
{"id": 4}
Response
{
  "data": {
    "validateCertificate": {
      "success": true,
      "isValid": true,
      "certificate": Certificate,
      "validationDetails": {},
      "errors": [CertificateError]
    }
  }
}

archiveContent

Description

Archives content while maintaining references and historical data. Affects visibility in courses and modules using this content.

@param id - ID of the content to archive @throws NotFoundError if content doesn't exist @throws StateError if content is already archived @throws AuthorizationError if user lacks archive permission

Response

Returns a ContentPayload!

Arguments
Name Description
id - ID!

Example

Query
mutation ArchiveContent($id: ID!) {
  archiveContent(id: $id) {
    success
    content {
      id
      type
      title
      description
      data
      duration
      url
      thumbnail
      interactivityType
      format
      language
      accessibility {
        ...AccessibilityInfoFragment
      }
      version
      metadata {
        ...ContentMetadataFragment
      }
    }
    errors {
      code
      message
      field
      details
    }
  }
}
Variables
{"id": "4"}
Response
{
  "data": {
    "archiveContent": {
      "success": false,
      "content": Content,
      "errors": [ContentError]
    }
  }
}

archiveCourse

Description

Archives a course, making it unavailable for new enrollments while preserving existing data. Enrolled students can still access content but new enrollments are blocked.

@param id - Unique identifier of the course to archive @throws NotFoundError if course doesn't exist @throws StateError if course is already archived @throws AuthorizationError if user lacks archive permission

Response

Returns a CoursePayload!

Arguments
Name Description
id - ID!

Example

Query
mutation ArchiveCourse($id: ID!) {
  archiveCourse(id: $id) {
    success
    course {
      id
      title
      description
      modules {
        ...ModuleFragment
      }
      instructors {
        ...InstructorFragment
      }
      enrollments {
        ...EnrollmentFragment
      }
      status
      difficultyLevel
      duration
      prerequisites {
        ...CourseFragment
      }
      learningObjectives
      skills {
        ...SkillFragment
      }
      assessments {
        ...AssessmentFragment
      }
      certificate {
        ...CertificateFragment
      }
      metadata {
        ...CourseMetadataFragment
      }
      reviews {
        ...ReviewFragment
      }
      rating
      accessLevel
      accessGroups
      visibility
      tags
      searchMetadata
      createdBy
      updatedBy
      version
      createdAt
      updatedAt
      auditLog {
        ...AuditEntryFragment
      }
      analytics {
        ...CourseAnalyticsFragment
      }
    }
    errors {
      code
      message
      field
      details
    }
  }
}
Variables
{"id": "4"}
Response
{
  "data": {
    "archiveCourse": {
      "success": false,
      "course": Course,
      "errors": [CourseError]
    }
  }
}

Types

AccessControlled

Description

Interface for content requiring access control. Access-controlled entities have defined access levels and groups, ensuring that only authorized users can view or modify them.

Fields
Field Name Description
accessLevel - AccessLevel!
accessGroups - [String!]!
visibility - Boolean!
Possible Types
AccessControlled Types

Course

Lesson
Example
{
  "accessLevel": "PUBLIC",
  "accessGroups": ["abc123"],
  "visibility": true
}

Description

Defines access control levels for content.

Values
Enum Value Description

PUBLIC

PRIVATE

ORGANIZATION

PREMIUM

INSTRUCTOR_ONLY
Example
"PUBLIC"
Types

ID

Description

The ID scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

Example
4
